glsa.title: noip-updater: Execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in noip-updater can lead to arbitrary code execution.

background.p: noip-updater is a tool used for updating IP addresses of dynamic DNS records at no-ip.com.

description.p: xenomuta found out that the GetNextLine() function in noip2.c misses a length check, leading to a stack-based buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code by sending a specially crafted HTTP message to the client. NOTE: Successful exploitation requires a man in the middle attack, a DNS spoofing attack or a compromise of no-ip.com servers.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
